entry.title: Newsletter #125
entry.content:

entry.title: Newsletter #107
entry.content:
Hi there!

Tech Thursday has come again! We had a big event last week!

Our nerdy “managers” went to Berlin last week to participate in the Rocket Tech Summit 2015

He like to be that casual! It was a good talk though :)

Links? Here they are!

  • “without google maps we’d be lost” – syrian refugee explains how he has been using apps bbc.co.uk/panorama

  • don’t fear the internet basico html & css for non-web designers

  • eight terminal utilities every os x command line user should know

  • five years, building a culture, and handing it off. — medium

  • go gc: prioritizing low latency and simplicity – the go blog

  • http://tech.namshi.io/blog/2015/09/10/newsletter-number-107/

  • Run similar commands concurrently

  • lovefield: the data access library that loves you

  • minimising font downloads – jakearchibald.com

  • php 7.0.0 rc 2 released

  • redis 3.0.4 and 2.8.22

entry.title: Newsletter #66
entry.content:
Hey folks from the software engineering community!

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Our comrade Alex is at SymfonyCon Madrid with an awesome and super exciting talk about angular.

Next week, Oba, Lucio and Alex will be at the super exciting Docker Eu Conference to collect some thoughts about the newest technologies.

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the week:

  • SERIOUS CONFUSION with Resource Timing

  • What’s in a Function Name?

  • The Real Cost of Slow Time vs Downtime

  • Microsoft brings Docker CLI to Windows

  • Rocket Internet-Backed Jumia Raises $150M For Its African E-Commerce Business

  • What is product design?

  • An interactive guide for exploring various important properties of the package.json for node.js apps

  • A Programmer Describes How He Nearly Went Insane Learning To Code

  • Codewars, improve your programming skills

  • React Tube Tracker – a simple application to check the predicted arrival times of trains at stations on the London Underground network built with React.

  • Yahoo! Mail moving to React

  • Docker vs VMs

  • Create your own Docker image

  • Service discovery with consul and consul-template

  • Building a complete Tweet index

  • VclFiddle is an online tool for experimenting with the Varnish Cache HTTP reverse-proxy

  • Sometimes Kill -9 Isn’t Enough

  • Performance Tuning EC2 Instances

  • Web-based PostgreSQL database browser

  • Go and JSON

  • Aurora on Amazon RDS

  • AWS Public IP Address Ranges Now Available in JSON Form

  • Which configuration management tool should you use?

  • A Saltstack salt-api and reactor formula for integrating HTTP webhooks with Saltstack executions

  • Jenkins: saltstack-plugin

  • Docker Security Flaw Found

  • Rackspace Page Load Speed checker

  • Auditing systemd: solving failed units with systemctl

  • Best Practices For Scaling Elasticsearch In The Cloud

  • Working with Elasticsearch

  • How we built the new BBC Homepage

  • wallaby.js runs your code when you write it

  • conveyor-belt

  • How the Node Foundation will Unify Node.js with io.js

  • Programm a virtual robot which moves in a 3D

  • npm subreddit
